intro: Calochortus clavatus, commonly known as the blunt-horned globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the genus Calochortus, which includes several species of flowering plants commonly referred to as marigold lilies. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and chaparral. Its flowers are showy, with bright yellow petals and a distinctive, rounded shape. Calochortus clavatus is known for its resilience to drought and its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
